javelin.controller.ai.valueselector

Class ValueSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.ai.valueselector.ValueSelector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MaxValueSelector, MinValueSelector

    public abstract class ValueSelector
extends java.lang.Object
    A step in the minimax tree, using alpha-beta prunning. Base class for min and max selectors.
    Author:
    Alex Henry
    See Also:
    MaxValueSelector, MinValueSelector, AlphaBetaSearch

    • Field Detail

      • failure

        public final float failure
        This is the worst possible utility value for this player. Used to seed Entry.value to force the dummy entry to be replaced with any valid game state.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public Entry getValue(Entry previous,
                      AlphaBetaSearch ai,
                      int depthP,
                      float alpha,
                      float beta,
                      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> index)
        Heart of the minimax search and alpha-beta pod. It's highly recommended to read the online literature to get a better grasp of what this does. A log can be written when executing this, just mind it that due to the nature of the search the log is written in reverse order of what it would be expected to be normally. The identation represents search depth. Each line is given with the utility value. Where X is shown a pod has been done, and the alpha/beta value shown as well. Those marked with * were chosen as the best option. Reducing the thinking time will usually produce less log output, which is easier for debugging.
        Parameters:
        previous - Last game state, so we can think of what to do now.
        ai - Used to encapsulate AI behavior, like utility computation. TODO make static
        depthP - Current depth (recursion depth).
        alpha - Current alpha for this path.
        beta - Current beta for this path.
        Returns:
        The AI's choice of action, the last state before a pod, or the given previous state but with it's utility value defined if we reached end of recursion.

      • newAlpha

        protected float newAlpha(float current,
                         float alpha)
        Lets subclasses use the alpha value.
        Parameters:

        alpha - Last alpha.
        Returns:

        protected abstract boolean testPod(float utility,

        Should perform a pod or not.
        Returns:

        Returns:
